get.description:
Configure and manage hardware module profiles.
A hardware module profile allows certain device-specific configuration to be applied
to a standalone switch, a chassis line-module or a VSF stack member. It is a mechanism
intended to ease the process of configuring these devices with the same set of
configurations. Instead of manually configuring each switch, line-module or VSF
member one-by-one, the hardware module profile collects the common configuration
settings and allows them to be applied to a specific device or a collection of
devices.
To apply a hardware module profile to a VSF member or group of VSF members, the
hw-profile name here must be referenced from their respective 'hw-profile' endpoints
in the 'switch-stack' API.
See `aruba-switch-stack:stacks/stack/members/hw-profile`.
Applicable to CX 6200, 6300, 6300L switches.
To apply a hardware module profile to a specific line-module or group of line-modules,
the profile name here must be referenced from their respective 'hw-profile' endpoint
in the switch-chassis' API.
See `aruba-switch-chassis:switch-chassis/chassis/line-modules/hw-profile`
Applicable to CX 6400, 8400X switches.
To apply a hardware module profile to a standalone switch, including devices that
support VSF but are not configured in a stack, no reference from another API is
required.

post.summary: Create hardware module profile by module name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the profile for the hardware module.

get.summary: Get hardware module profile by module name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the profile for the hardware module.

patch.summary: Update hardware module profile by module name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the profile for the hardware module.

delete.summary: Delete hardware module profile by module name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the profile for the hardware module.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaHardwareModuleProfile_HardwareModul.description:
Configure and manage hardware module profiles.
A hardware module profile allows certain device-specific configuration to be applied
to a standalone switch, a chassis line-module or a VSF stack member. It is a mechanism
intended to ease the process of configuring these devices with the same set of
configurations. Instead of manually configuring each switch, line-module or VSF
member one-by-one, the hardware module profile collects the common configuration
settings and allows them to be applied to a specific device or a collection of
devices.
To apply a hardware module profile to a VSF member or group of VSF members, the
hw-profile name here must be referenced from their respective 'hw-profile' endpoints
in the 'switch-stack' API.
See `aruba-switch-stack:stacks/stack/members/hw-profile`.
Applicable to CX 6200, 6300, 6300L switches.
To apply a hardware module profile to a specific line-module or group of line-modules,
the profile name here must be referenced from their respective 'hw-profile' endpoint
in the switch-chassis' API.
See `aruba-switch-chassis:switch-chassis/chassis/line-modules/hw-profile`
Applicable to CX 6400, 8400X switches.
To apply a hardware module profile to a standalone switch, including devices that
support VSF but are not configured in a stack, no reference from another API is
required.

name.description: The name of the profile for the hardware module.

description.description: A module description, used to identify what is configured and how it is configured.

items.description:
Specifies the list of member or slot IDs to which this profile applies.
- For standalone switches: This list is ignored.
- For VSF stacks: List the member IDs that should use this profile.
- For chassis systems: List the slot IDs that should use this profile.
Note: For slot names like '1/3', only the slot number (e.g., 3) is used as the slot ID.

quick-poe.description:
Enable quick-poe configuration. quick-poe allows the PSE
to power up connected PDs soon after a cold reboot. On standalone
devices this applies globally, on VSF it applies to the 'Member' and
in chassis devices this is applicable to the 'Line Cards'.

always-on-poe.description:
Always-on PoE provides ability to continue power delivery during
a soft/warm reboot. On standalone devices this applies globally,
on VSF it applies to the 'Member' and in chassis devices this is
applicable to the 'Line Cards'.

interface-group-speed-profile.description:
Some switch models have a restriction that all transceivers installed in
a group of ports must have compatible speeds. All mismatched interfaces
in the group will be disabled.

group-id.description: Device dependent interface group identifier for a set of port.

speed.description: Interface group speed. Device dependent, the possible speeds are 10g, 25g, 40g, 50g, 100g or 200g.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.
